page.title: 05HEALTH CARE IN WELSHPOOL
page.content: There are{four doctors}in Welshpool working from{Welshpool Medical Centre. There are about 7,600 patients in the Welshpool area and each doctor sees on average about 30 each day. To help them the doctors have 8 secretaries and 6 nurses. There is also a branch surgery at Guilsfield,about 4 miles away,which each doctor attends one afternoon a week. Although the Medical Centre closes at 18:00 emergency cover is provided for the full 24 hours. {The Victoria Memorial Hospital,}built in 1902, is a small cottage hospital consisting of 3 wards. The Geriatric Ward has 30 beds, the General Ward 15 beds and the Maternity Ward 8 beds. On the wards there are 55 nurses each working 10 hour shifts.Most cases treated in casualty are minor with serious ones sent to the larger hospitals at Gobowen or Shrewsbury.
